Articles.Content: Floor 748: The room is filled with hundreds of mirrors. It takes about three hours to continue to the next floor.
Floor 749: A rocket is stuck in the window with 'Mun or Bust' written on the side.
Floor 750: Tornadoes. One swirls you around around til' you are catapulted to floor 751
Floor 751: Anti-Tornado machines. They're all on fire.
floor 752: just air in some space
Floor 753: Space in some air.
floor 754: Ahhh the sun is so bright
Floor 755: You see a sign and a bright passage, "Now aproaching Sun's Core", after a while of walking the Kraken grabs you and hurls you to floor 756!
Floor 756: The Kraken is made of cupcakes. Orange markets extend into the distance.
Floor 757: What you see is so horrible and ungodly that you delete it from your memory.
Floor 758: What you see is so cute and pretty that you die. You wake up on floor 759.
Floor 759: You finally get to your hotel room, but you continue up to explore the rest of the building.
Floor 760: The reverse-gravity increases even faster than before (wormhole at floor 765!)!
Floor 761: This floor is made of cake, you said? LIES!
Floor 762: You look out of the window and find an astonishingly beautiful view, but as you think that you rush to the next floor to avoid a satellite that flies trough the building.
Floor 763: The satellite has come back for another pass. THEY'RE ON TO YOU.

Floor 764: You look down at the planet below you. The air is now brown, the ground is now covered in scavengers and rubble of what appears to be vehicles. How long have you been ascending? The window slowly dims and a voice is heard behind you, and in front of you, and above you. The robotic, nearly angelic voice says to you: "You are not aloud to see that. Yet."
Floor 765: A wormhole appears, and several Kerbals walk out, with briefcases full of snacks.
Floor 766: The wormhole from previous floor destroys this floor, sucking you in with it, but not before you take the Kerbals from floor 765 with you.
Floor 767: The wormhole from the previous two floors deposits you onto this floor before disappearing.
Floor 768: Another wormhole appears, and a giant Kerbal walks out, holding a orange tank full of snacks.
Floor 768: The entire floor looks like a cartoon desert, and you are so fascinated by a bird that you see that you do not notice yourself walking off of a cliff into midair.
Floor 769: Fortunately you step into the exhaust blast of a throttled-down Mainsail, which catapults you to this floor.
Floor 770: Doh !!! a Do Nuts.
Floor 771: The Tetris theme is playing in the background.
